2261MachineBlockPlacement::hasViableTopFallthrough(
2262 const MachineBasicBlock *Top,
2263 const BlockFilterSet &LoopBlockSet) {
2264 for (MachineBasicBlock *Pred : Top->predecessors()) {
2265 BlockChain *PredChain = BlockToChain[Pred];
2266 if (!LoopBlockSet.count(Pred) &&
2267 (!PredChain || Pred == *std::prev(PredChain->end()))) {
2268 // Found a Pred block can be placed before Top.
2269 // Check if Top is the best successor of Pred.
2270 auto TopProb = MBPI->getEdgeProbability(Pred, Top);
2271 bool TopOK = true;
2272 for (MachineBasicBlock *Succ : Pred->successors()) {
2273 auto SuccProb = MBPI->getEdgeProbability(Pred, Succ);
2274 BlockChain *SuccChain = BlockToChain[Succ];
2275 // Check if Succ can be placed after Pred.
2276 // Succ should not be in any chain, or it is the head of some chain.
2277 if ((!SuccChain || Succ == *SuccChain->begin()) && SuccProb > TopProb) {
2278 TopOK = false;
2279 break;
2280 }
2281 }
2282 if (TopOK)
2283 return true;
2284 }
2285 }
2286 return false;
2287}
2288
2289/// Attempt to rotate an exiting block to the bottom of the loop.
2290///
2291/// Once we have built a chain, try to rotate it to line up the hot exit block
2292/// with fallthrough out of the loop if doing so doesn't introduce unnecessary
2293/// branches. For example, if the loop has fallthrough into its header and out
2294/// of its bottom already, don't rotate it.
2295void MachineBlockPlacement::rotateLoop(BlockChain &LoopChain,
2296 const MachineBasicBlock *ExitingBB,
2297 BlockFrequency ExitFreq,
2298 const BlockFilterSet &LoopBlockSet) {
2299 if (!ExitingBB)
2300 return;
2301
2302 MachineBasicBlock *Top = *LoopChain.begin();
2303 MachineBasicBlock *Bottom = *std::prev(LoopChain.end());
2304
2305 // If ExitingBB is already the last one in a chain then nothing to do.
2306 if (Bottom == ExitingBB)
2307 return;
2308
2309 // The entry block should always be the first BB in a function.
2310 if (Top->isEntryBlock())
2311 return;
2312
2313 bool ViableTopFallthrough = hasViableTopFallthrough(Top, LoopBlockSet);
2314
2315 // If the header has viable fallthrough, check whether the current loop
2316 // bottom is a viable exiting block. If so, bail out as rotating will
2317 // introduce an unnecessary branch.
2318 if (ViableTopFallthrough) {
2319 for (MachineBasicBlock *Succ : Bottom->successors()) {
2320 BlockChain *SuccChain = BlockToChain[Succ];
2321 if (!LoopBlockSet.count(Succ) &&
2322 (!SuccChain || Succ == *SuccChain->begin()))
2323 return;
2324 }
2325
2326 // Rotate will destroy the top fallthrough, we need to ensure the new exit
2327 // frequency is larger than top fallthrough.
2328 BlockFrequency FallThrough2Top = TopFallThroughFreq(Top, LoopBlockSet);
2329 if (FallThrough2Top >= ExitFreq)
2330 return;
2331 }
2332
2333 BlockChain::iterator ExitIt = llvm::find(LoopChain, ExitingBB);
2334 if (ExitIt == LoopChain.end())
2335 return;
2336
2337 // Rotating a loop exit to the bottom when there is a fallthrough to top
2338 // trades the entry fallthrough for an exit fallthrough.
2339 // If there is no bottom->top edge, but the chosen exit block does have
2340 // a fallthrough, we break that fallthrough for nothing in return.
2341
2342 // Let's consider an example. We have a built chain of basic blocks
2343 // B1, B2, ..., Bn, where Bk is a ExitingBB - chosen exit block.
2344 // By doing a rotation we get
2345 // Bk+1, ..., Bn, B1, ..., Bk
2346 // Break of fallthrough to B1 is compensated by a fallthrough from Bk.
2347 // If we had a fallthrough Bk -> Bk+1 it is broken now.
2348 // It might be compensated by fallthrough Bn -> B1.
2349 // So we have a condition to avoid creation of extra branch by loop rotation.
2350 // All below must be true to avoid loop rotation:
2351 // If there is a fallthrough to top (B1)
2352 // There was fallthrough from chosen exit block (Bk) to next one (Bk+1)
2353 // There is no fallthrough from bottom (Bn) to top (B1).
2354 // Please note that there is no exit fallthrough from Bn because we checked it
2355 // above.
2356 if (ViableTopFallthrough) {
2357 assert(std::next(ExitIt) != LoopChain.end() &&
2358 "Exit should not be last BB");
2359 MachineBasicBlock *NextBlockInChain = *std::next(ExitIt);
2360 if (ExitingBB->isSuccessor(NextBlockInChain))
2361 if (!Bottom->isSuccessor(Top))
2362 return;
2363 }
2364
2365 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Rotating loop to put exit " << getBlockName(ExitingBB)
2366 << " at bottom\n");
2367 std::rotate(LoopChain.begin(), std::next(ExitIt), LoopChain.end());
2368}
2369
2370/// Attempt to rotate a loop based on profile data to reduce branch cost.
2371///
2372/// With profile data, we can determine the cost in terms of missed fall through
2373/// opportunities when rotating a loop chain and select the best rotation.
2374/// Basically, there are three kinds of cost to consider for each rotation:
2375/// 1. The possibly missed fall through edge (if it exists) from BB out of
2376/// the loop to the loop header.
2377/// 2. The possibly missed fall through edges (if they exist) from the loop
2378/// exits to BB out of the loop.
2379/// 3. The missed fall through edge (if it exists) from the last BB to the
2380/// first BB in the loop chain.
2381/// Therefore, the cost for a given rotation is the sum of costs listed above.
2382/// We select the best rotation with the smallest cost.
2383void MachineBlockPlacement::rotateLoopWithProfile(
2384 BlockChain &LoopChain, const MachineLoop &L,
2385 const BlockFilterSet &LoopBlockSet) {
2386 auto RotationPos = LoopChain.end();
2387 MachineBasicBlock *ChainHeaderBB = *LoopChain.begin();
2388
2389 // The entry block should always be the first BB in a function.
2390 if (ChainHeaderBB->isEntryBlock())
2391 return;
2392
2393 BlockFrequency SmallestRotationCost = BlockFrequency::getMaxFrequency();
2394
2395 // A utility lambda that scales up a block frequency by dividing it by a
2396 // branch probability which is the reciprocal of the scale.
2397 auto ScaleBlockFrequency = [](BlockFrequency Freq,
2398 unsigned Scale) -> BlockFrequency {
2399 if (Scale == 0)
2400 return 0;
2401 // Use operator / between BlockFrequency and BranchProbability to implement
2402 // saturating multiplication.
2403 return Freq / BranchProbability(1, Scale);
2404 };
2405
2406 // Compute the cost of the missed fall-through edge to the loop header if the
2407 // chain head is not the loop header. As we only consider natural loops with
2408 // single header, this computation can be done only once.
2409 BlockFrequency HeaderFallThroughCost(0);
2410 for (auto *Pred : ChainHeaderBB->predecessors()) {
2411 BlockChain *PredChain = BlockToChain[Pred];
2412 if (!LoopBlockSet.count(Pred) &&
2413 (!PredChain || Pred == *std::prev(PredChain->end()))) {
2414 auto EdgeFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(Pred) *
2415 MBPI->getEdgeProbability(Pred, ChainHeaderBB);
2416 auto FallThruCost = ScaleBlockFrequency(EdgeFreq, MisfetchCost);
2417 // If the predecessor has only an unconditional jump to the header, we
2418 // need to consider the cost of this jump.
2419 if (Pred->succ_size() == 1)
2420 FallThruCost += ScaleBlockFrequency(EdgeFreq, JumpInstCost);
2421 HeaderFallThroughCost = std::max(HeaderFallThroughCost, FallThruCost);
2422 }
2423 }
2424
2425 // Here we collect all exit blocks in the loop, and for each exit we find out
2426 // its hottest exit edge. For each loop rotation, we define the loop exit cost
2427 // as the sum of frequencies of exit edges we collect here, excluding the exit
2428 // edge from the tail of the loop chain.
2429 SmallVector<std::pair<MachineBasicBlock *, BlockFrequency>, 4> ExitsWithFreq;
2430 for (auto BB : LoopChain) {
2431 auto LargestExitEdgeProb = BranchProbability::getZero();
2432 for (auto *Succ : BB->successors()) {
2433 BlockChain *SuccChain = BlockToChain[Succ];
2434 if (!LoopBlockSet.count(Succ) &&
2435 (!SuccChain || Succ == *SuccChain->begin())) {
2436 auto SuccProb = MBPI->getEdgeProbability(BB, Succ);
2437 LargestExitEdgeProb = std::max(LargestExitEdgeProb, SuccProb);
2438 }
2439 }
2440 if (LargestExitEdgeProb > BranchProbability::getZero()) {
2441 auto ExitFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(BB) * LargestExitEdgeProb;
2442 ExitsWithFreq.emplace_back(BB, ExitFreq);
2443 }
2444 }
2445
2446 // In this loop we iterate every block in the loop chain and calculate the
2447 // cost assuming the block is the head of the loop chain. When the loop ends,
2448 // we should have found the best candidate as the loop chain's head.
2449 for (auto Iter = LoopChain.begin(), TailIter = std::prev(LoopChain.end()),
2450 EndIter = LoopChain.end();
2451 Iter != EndIter; Iter++, TailIter++) {
2452 // TailIter is used to track the tail of the loop chain if the block we are
2453 // checking (pointed by Iter) is the head of the chain.
2454 if (TailIter == LoopChain.end())
2455 TailIter = LoopChain.begin();
2456
2457 auto TailBB = *TailIter;
2458
2459 // Calculate the cost by putting this BB to the top.
2460 BlockFrequency Cost = 0;
2461
2462 // If the current BB is the loop header, we need to take into account the
2463 // cost of the missed fall through edge from outside of the loop to the
2464 // header.
2465 if (Iter != LoopChain.begin())
2466 Cost += HeaderFallThroughCost;
2467
2468 // Collect the loop exit cost by summing up frequencies of all exit edges
2469 // except the one from the chain tail.
2470 for (auto &ExitWithFreq : ExitsWithFreq)
2471 if (TailBB != ExitWithFreq.first)
2472 Cost += ExitWithFreq.second;
2473
2474 // The cost of breaking the once fall-through edge from the tail to the top
2475 // of the loop chain. Here we need to consider three cases:
2476 // 1. If the tail node has only one successor, then we will get an
2477 // additional jmp instruction. So the cost here is (MisfetchCost +
2478 // JumpInstCost) * tail node frequency.
2479 // 2. If the tail node has two successors, then we may still get an
2480 // additional jmp instruction if the layout successor after the loop
2481 // chain is not its CFG successor. Note that the more frequently executed
2482 // jmp instruction will be put ahead of the other one. Assume the
2483 // frequency of those two branches are x and y, where x is the frequency
2484 // of the edge to the chain head, then the cost will be
2485 // (x * MisfetechCost + min(x, y) * JumpInstCost) * tail node frequency.
2486 // 3. If the tail node has more than two successors (this rarely happens),
2487 // we won't consider any additional cost.
2488 if (TailBB->isSuccessor(*Iter)) {
2489 auto TailBBFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(TailBB);
2490 if (TailBB->succ_size() == 1)
2491 Cost += ScaleBlockFrequency(TailBBFreq.getFrequency(),
2492 MisfetchCost + JumpInstCost);
2493 else if (TailBB->succ_size() == 2) {
2494 auto TailToHeadProb = MBPI->getEdgeProbability(TailBB, *Iter);
2495 auto TailToHeadFreq = TailBBFreq * TailToHeadProb;
2496 auto ColderEdgeFreq = TailToHeadProb > BranchProbability(1, 2)
2497 ? TailBBFreq * TailToHeadProb.getCompl()
2498 : TailToHeadFreq;
2499 Cost += ScaleBlockFrequency(TailToHeadFreq, MisfetchCost) +
2500 ScaleBlockFrequency(ColderEdgeFreq, JumpInstCost);
2501 }
2502 }
2503
2504 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "The cost of loop rotation by making "
2505 << getBlockName(*Iter)
2506 << " to the top: " << Cost.getFrequency() << "\n");
2507
2508 if (Cost < SmallestRotationCost) {
2509 SmallestRotationCost = Cost;
2510 RotationPos = Iter;
2511 }
2512 }
2513
2514 if (RotationPos != LoopChain.end()) {
2515 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Rotate loop by making " << getBlockName(*RotationPos)
2516 << " to the top\n");
2517 std::rotate(LoopChain.begin(), RotationPos, LoopChain.end());
2518 }
2519}
2520
2521/// Collect blocks in the given loop that are to be placed.
2522///
2523/// When profile data is available, exclude cold blocks from the returned set;
2524/// otherwise, collect all blocks in the loop.
2525MachineBlockPlacement::BlockFilterSet
2526MachineBlockPlacement::collectLoopBlockSet(const MachineLoop &L) {
2527 BlockFilterSet LoopBlockSet;
2528
2529 // Filter cold blocks off from LoopBlockSet when profile data is available.
2530 // Collect the sum of frequencies of incoming edges to the loop header from
2531 // outside. If we treat the loop as a super block, this is the frequency of
2532 // the loop. Then for each block in the loop, we calculate the ratio between
2533 // its frequency and the frequency of the loop block. When it is too small,
2534 // don't add it to the loop chain. If there are outer loops, then this block
2535 // will be merged into the first outer loop chain for which this block is not
2536 // cold anymore. This needs precise profile data and we only do this when
2537 // profile data is available.
2538 if (F->getFunction().hasProfileData() || ForceLoopColdBlock) {
2539 BlockFrequency LoopFreq(0);
2540 for (auto LoopPred : L.getHeader()->predecessors())
2541 if (!L.contains(LoopPred))
2542 LoopFreq += MBFI->getBlockFreq(LoopPred) *
2543 MBPI->getEdgeProbability(LoopPred, L.getHeader());
2544
2545 for (MachineBasicBlock *LoopBB : L.getBlocks()) {
2546 if (LoopBlockSet.count(LoopBB))
2547 continue;
2548 auto Freq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(LoopBB).getFrequency();
2549 if (Freq == 0 || LoopFreq.getFrequency() / Freq > LoopToColdBlockRatio)
2550 continue;
2551 BlockChain *Chain = BlockToChain[LoopBB];
2552 for (MachineBasicBlock *ChainBB : *Chain)
2553 LoopBlockSet.insert(ChainBB);
2554 }
2555 } else
2556 LoopBlockSet.insert(L.block_begin(), L.block_end());
2557
2558 return LoopBlockSet;
2559}
2560
2561/// Forms basic block chains from the natural loop structures.
2562///
2563/// These chains are designed to preserve the existing *structure* of the code
2564/// as much as possible. We can then stitch the chains together in a way which
2565/// both preserves the topological structure and minimizes taken conditional
2566/// branches.
2567void MachineBlockPlacement::buildLoopChains(const MachineLoop &L) {
2568 // First recurse through any nested loops, building chains for those inner
2569 // loops.
2570 for (const MachineLoop *InnerLoop : L)
2571 buildLoopChains(*InnerLoop);
2572
2573 assert(BlockWorkList.empty() &&
2574 "BlockWorkList not empty when starting to build loop chains.");
2575 assert(EHPadWorkList.empty() &&
2576 "EHPadWorkList not empty when starting to build loop chains.");
2577 BlockFilterSet LoopBlockSet = collectLoopBlockSet(L);
2578
2579 // Check if we have profile data for this function. If yes, we will rotate
2580 // this loop by modeling costs more precisely which requires the profile data
2581 // for better layout.
2582 bool RotateLoopWithProfile =
2583 ForcePreciseRotationCost ||
2584 (PreciseRotationCost && F->getFunction().hasProfileData());
2585
2586 // First check to see if there is an obviously preferable top block for the
2587 // loop. This will default to the header, but may end up as one of the
2588 // predecessors to the header if there is one which will result in strictly
2589 // fewer branches in the loop body.
2590 MachineBasicBlock *LoopTop = findBestLoopTop(L, LoopBlockSet);
2591
2592 // If we selected just the header for the loop top, look for a potentially
2593 // profitable exit block in the event that rotating the loop can eliminate
2594 // branches by placing an exit edge at the bottom.
2595 //
2596 // Loops are processed innermost to uttermost, make sure we clear
2597 // PreferredLoopExit before processing a new loop.
2598 PreferredLoopExit = nullptr;
2599 BlockFrequency ExitFreq;
2600 if (!RotateLoopWithProfile && LoopTop == L.getHeader())
2601 PreferredLoopExit = findBestLoopExit(L, LoopBlockSet, ExitFreq);
2602
2603 BlockChain &LoopChain = *BlockToChain[LoopTop];
2604
2605 // FIXME: This is a really lame way of walking the chains in the loop: we
2606 // walk the blocks, and use a set to prevent visiting a particular chain
2607 // twice.
2608 SmallPtrSet<BlockChain *, 4> UpdatedPreds;
2609 assert(LoopChain.UnscheduledPredecessors == 0 &&
2610 "LoopChain should not have unscheduled predecessors.");
2611 UpdatedPreds.insert(&LoopChain);
2612
2613 for (const MachineBasicBlock *LoopBB : LoopBlockSet)
2614 fillWorkLists(LoopBB, UpdatedPreds, &LoopBlockSet);
2615
2616 buildChain(LoopTop, LoopChain, &LoopBlockSet);
2617
2618 if (RotateLoopWithProfile)
2619 rotateLoopWithProfile(LoopChain, L, LoopBlockSet);
2620 else
2621 rotateLoop(LoopChain, PreferredLoopExit, ExitFreq, LoopBlockSet);
2622
2623 LLVM_DEBUG({
2624 // Crash at the end so we get all of the debugging output first.
2625 bool BadLoop = false;
2626 if (LoopChain.UnscheduledPredecessors) {
2627 BadLoop = true;
2628 dbgs() << "Loop chain contains a block without its preds placed!\n"
2629 << " Loop header: " << getBlockName(*L.block_begin()) << "\n"
2630 << " Chain header: " << getBlockName(*LoopChain.begin()) << "\n";
2631 }
2632 for (MachineBasicBlock *ChainBB : LoopChain) {
2633 dbgs() << " ... " << getBlockName(ChainBB) << "\n";
2634 if (!LoopBlockSet.remove(ChainBB)) {
2635 // We don't mark the loop as bad here because there are real situations
2636 // where this can occur. For example, with an unanalyzable fallthrough
2637 // from a loop block to a non-loop block or vice versa.
2638 dbgs() << "Loop chain contains a block not contained by the loop!\n"
2639 << " Loop header: " << getBlockName(*L.block_begin()) << "\n"
2640 << " Chain header: " << getBlockName(*LoopChain.begin()) << "\n"
2641 << " Bad block: " << getBlockName(ChainBB) << "\n";
2642 }
2643 }
2644
2645 if (!LoopBlockSet.empty()) {
2646 BadLoop = true;
2647 for (const MachineBasicBlock *LoopBB : LoopBlockSet)
2648 dbgs() << "Loop contains blocks never placed into a chain!\n"
2649 << " Loop header: " << getBlockName(*L.block_begin()) << "\n"
2650 << " Chain header: " << getBlockName(*LoopChain.begin()) << "\n"
2651 << " Bad block: " << getBlockName(LoopBB) << "\n";
2652 }
2653 assert(!BadLoop && "Detected problems with the placement of this loop.");
2654 });
2655
2656 BlockWorkList.clear();
2657 EHPadWorkList.clear();
2658}
2659
2660void MachineBlockPlacement::buildCFGChains() {
2661 // Ensure that every BB in the function has an associated chain to simplify
2662 // the assumptions of the remaining algorithm.
2663 SmallVector<MachineOperand, 4> Cond; // For analyzeBranch.
2664 for (MachineFunction::iterator FI = F->begin(), FE = F->end(); FI != FE;
2665 ++FI) {
2666 MachineBasicBlock *BB = &*FI;
2667 BlockChain *Chain =
2668 new (ChainAllocator.Allocate()) BlockChain(BlockToChain, BB);
2669 // Also, merge any blocks which we cannot reason about and must preserve
2670 // the exact fallthrough behavior for.
2671 while (true) {
2672 Cond.clear();
2673 MachineBasicBlock *TBB = nullptr, *FBB = nullptr; // For analyzeBranch.
2674 if (!TII->analyzeBranch(*BB, TBB, FBB, Cond) || !FI->canFallThrough())
2675 break;
2676
2677 MachineFunction::iterator NextFI = std::next(FI);
2678 MachineBasicBlock *NextBB = &*NextFI;
2679 // Ensure that the layout successor is a viable block, as we know that
2680 // fallthrough is a possibility.
2681 assert(NextFI != FE && "Can't fallthrough past the last block.");
2682 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Pre-merging due to unanalyzable fallthrough: "
2683 << getBlockName(BB) << " -> " << getBlockName(NextBB)
2684 << "\n");
2685 Chain->merge(NextBB, nullptr);
2686#ifndef NDEBUG
2687 BlocksWithUnanalyzableExits.insert(&*BB);
2688#endif
2689 FI = NextFI;
2690 BB = NextBB;
2691 }
2692 }
2693
2694 // Build any loop-based chains.
2695 PreferredLoopExit = nullptr;
2696 for (MachineLoop *L : *MLI)
2697 buildLoopChains(*L);
2698
2699 assert(BlockWorkList.empty() &&
2700 "BlockWorkList should be empty before building final chain.");
2701 assert(EHPadWorkList.empty() &&
2702 "EHPadWorkList should be empty before building final chain.");
2703
2704 SmallPtrSet<BlockChain *, 4> UpdatedPreds;
2705 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *F)
2706 fillWorkLists(&MBB, UpdatedPreds);
2707
2708 BlockChain &FunctionChain = *BlockToChain[&F->front()];
2709 buildChain(&F->front(), FunctionChain);
2710
2711#ifndef NDEBUG
2712 using FunctionBlockSetType = SmallPtrSet<MachineBasicBlock *, 16>;
2713#endif
2714 LLVM_DEBUG({
2715 // Crash at the end so we get all of the debugging output first.
2716 bool BadFunc = false;
2717 FunctionBlockSetType FunctionBlockSet;
2718 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *F)
2719 FunctionBlockSet.insert(&MBB);
2720
2721 for (MachineBasicBlock *ChainBB : FunctionChain)
2722 if (!FunctionBlockSet.erase(ChainBB)) {
2723 BadFunc = true;
2724 dbgs() << "Function chain contains a block not in the function!\n"
2725 << " Bad block: " << getBlockName(ChainBB) << "\n";
2726 }
2727
2728 if (!FunctionBlockSet.empty()) {
2729 BadFunc = true;
2730 for (MachineBasicBlock *RemainingBB : FunctionBlockSet)
2731 dbgs() << "Function contains blocks never placed into a chain!\n"
2732 << " Bad block: " << getBlockName(RemainingBB) << "\n";
2733 }
2734 assert(!BadFunc && "Detected problems with the block placement.");
2735 });
2736
2737 // Remember original layout ordering, so we can update terminators after
2738 // reordering to point to the original layout successor.
2739 SmallVector<MachineBasicBlock *, 4> OriginalLayoutSuccessors(
2740 F->getNumBlockIDs());
2741 {
2742 MachineBasicBlock *LastMBB = nullptr;
2743 for (auto &MBB : *F) {
2744 if (LastMBB != nullptr)
2745 OriginalLayoutSuccessors[LastMBB->getNumber()] = &MBB;
2746 LastMBB = &MBB;
2747 }
2748 OriginalLayoutSuccessors[F->back().getNumber()] = nullptr;
2749 }
2750
2751 // Splice the blocks into place.
2752 MachineFunction::iterator InsertPos = F->begin();
2753 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "[MBP] Function: " << F->getName() << "\n");
2754 for (MachineBasicBlock *ChainBB : FunctionChain) {
2755 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << (ChainBB == *FunctionChain.begin() ? "Placing chain "
2756 : " ... ")
2757 << getBlockName(ChainBB) << "\n");
2758 if (InsertPos != MachineFunction::iterator(ChainBB))
2759 F->splice(InsertPos, ChainBB);
2760 else
2761 ++InsertPos;
2762
2763 // Update the terminator of the previous block.
2764 if (ChainBB == *FunctionChain.begin())
2765 continue;
2766 MachineBasicBlock *PrevBB = &*std::prev(MachineFunction::iterator(ChainBB));
2767
2768 // FIXME: It would be awesome of updateTerminator would just return rather
2769 // than assert when the branch cannot be analyzed in order to remove this
2770 // boiler plate.
2771 Cond.clear();
2772 MachineBasicBlock *TBB = nullptr, *FBB = nullptr; // For analyzeBranch.
2773
2774#ifndef NDEBUG
2775 if (!BlocksWithUnanalyzableExits.count(PrevBB)) {
2776 // Given the exact block placement we chose, we may actually not _need_ to
2777 // be able to edit PrevBB's terminator sequence, but not being _able_ to
2778 // do that at this point is a bug.
2779 assert((!TII->analyzeBranch(*PrevBB, TBB, FBB, Cond) ||
2780 !PrevBB->canFallThrough()) &&
2781 "Unexpected block with un-analyzable fallthrough!");
2782 Cond.clear();
2783 TBB = FBB = nullptr;
2784 }
2785#endif
2786
2787 // The "PrevBB" is not yet updated to reflect current code layout, so,
2788 // o. it may fall-through to a block without explicit "goto" instruction
2789 // before layout, and no longer fall-through it after layout; or
2790 // o. just opposite.
2791 //
2792 // analyzeBranch() may return erroneous value for FBB when these two
2793 // situations take place. For the first scenario FBB is mistakenly set NULL;
2794 // for the 2nd scenario, the FBB, which is expected to be NULL, is
2795 // mistakenly pointing to "*BI".
2796 // Thus, if the future change needs to use FBB before the layout is set, it
2797 // has to correct FBB first by using the code similar to the following:
2798 //
2799 // if (!Cond.empty() && (!FBB || FBB == ChainBB)) {
2800 // PrevBB->updateTerminator();
2801 // Cond.clear();
2802 // TBB = FBB = nullptr;
2803 // if (TII->analyzeBranch(*PrevBB, TBB, FBB, Cond)) {
2804 // // FIXME: This should never take place.
2805 // TBB = FBB = nullptr;
2806 // }
2807 // }
2808 if (!TII->analyzeBranch(*PrevBB, TBB, FBB, Cond)) {
2809 PrevBB->updateTerminator(OriginalLayoutSuccessors[PrevBB->getNumber()]);
2810 }
2811 }
2812
2813 // Fixup the last block.
2814 Cond.clear();
2815 MachineBasicBlock *TBB = nullptr, *FBB = nullptr; // For analyzeBranch.
2816 if (!TII->analyzeBranch(F->back(), TBB, FBB, Cond)) {
2817 MachineBasicBlock *PrevBB = &F->back();
2818 PrevBB->updateTerminator(OriginalLayoutSuccessors[PrevBB->getNumber()]);
2819 }
2820
2821 BlockWorkList.clear();
2822 EHPadWorkList.clear();
2823}
2824
2825void MachineBlockPlacement::optimizeBranches() {
2826 BlockChain &FunctionChain = *BlockToChain[&F->front()];
2827 SmallVector<MachineOperand, 4> Cond; // For analyzeBranch.
2828
2829 // Now that all the basic blocks in the chain have the proper layout,
2830 // make a final call to analyzeBranch with AllowModify set.
2831 // Indeed, the target may be able to optimize the branches in a way we
2832 // cannot because all branches may not be analyzable.
2833 // E.g., the target may be able to remove an unconditional branch to
2834 // a fallthrough when it occurs after predicated terminators.
2835 for (MachineBasicBlock *ChainBB : FunctionChain) {
2836 Cond.clear();
2837 MachineBasicBlock *TBB = nullptr, *FBB = nullptr; // For analyzeBranch.
2838 if (!TII->analyzeBranch(*ChainBB, TBB, FBB, Cond, /*AllowModify*/ true)) {
2839 // If PrevBB has a two-way branch, try to re-order the branches
2840 // such that we branch to the successor with higher probability first.
2841 if (TBB && !Cond.empty() && FBB &&
2842 MBPI->getEdgeProbability(ChainBB, FBB) >
2843 MBPI->getEdgeProbability(ChainBB, TBB) &&
2844 !TII->reverseBranchCondition(Cond)) {
2845 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Reverse order of the two branches: "
2846 << getBlockName(ChainBB) << "\n");
2847 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << " Edge probability: "
2848 << MBPI->getEdgeProbability(ChainBB, FBB) << " vs "
2849 << MBPI->getEdgeProbability(ChainBB, TBB) << "\n");
2850 DebugLoc dl; // FIXME: this is nowhere
2851 TII->removeBranch(*ChainBB);
2852 TII->insertBranch(*ChainBB, FBB, TBB, Cond, dl);
2853 }
2854 }
2855 }
2856}
2857
2858void MachineBlockPlacement::alignBlocks() {
2859 // Walk through the backedges of the function now that we have fully laid out
2860 // the basic blocks and align the destination of each backedge. We don't rely
2861 // exclusively on the loop info here so that we can align backedges in
2862 // unnatural CFGs and backedges that were introduced purely because of the
2863 // loop rotations done during this layout pass.
2864 if (F->getFunction().hasMinSize() ||
2865 (F->getFunction().hasOptSize() && !TLI->alignLoopsWithOptSize()))
2866 return;
2867 BlockChain &FunctionChain = *BlockToChain[&F->front()];
2868 if (FunctionChain.begin() == FunctionChain.end())
2869 return; // Empty chain.
2870
2871 const BranchProbability ColdProb(1, 5); // 20%
2872 BlockFrequency EntryFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(&F->front());
2873 BlockFrequency WeightedEntryFreq = EntryFreq * ColdProb;
2874 for (MachineBasicBlock *ChainBB : FunctionChain) {
2875 if (ChainBB == *FunctionChain.begin())
2876 continue;
2877
2878 // Don't align non-looping basic blocks. These are unlikely to execute
2879 // enough times to matter in practice. Note that we'll still handle
2880 // unnatural CFGs inside of a natural outer loop (the common case) and
2881 // rotated loops.
2882 MachineLoop *L = MLI->getLoopFor(ChainBB);
2883 if (!L)
2884 continue;
2885
2886 const Align Align = TLI->getPrefLoopAlignment(L);
2887 if (Align == 1)
2888 continue; // Don't care about loop alignment.
2889
2890 // If the block is cold relative to the function entry don't waste space
2891 // aligning it.
2892 BlockFrequency Freq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(ChainBB);
2893 if (Freq < WeightedEntryFreq)
2894 continue;
2895
2896 // If the block is cold relative to its loop header, don't align it
2897 // regardless of what edges into the block exist.
2898 MachineBasicBlock *LoopHeader = L->getHeader();
2899 BlockFrequency LoopHeaderFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(LoopHeader);
2900 if (Freq < (LoopHeaderFreq * ColdProb))
2901 continue;
2902
2903 // If the global profiles indicates so, don't align it.
2904 if (llvm::shouldOptimizeForSize(ChainBB, PSI, MBFI.get()) &&
2905 !TLI->alignLoopsWithOptSize())
2906 continue;
2907
2908 // Check for the existence of a non-layout predecessor which would benefit
2909 // from aligning this block.
2910 MachineBasicBlock *LayoutPred =
2911 &*std::prev(MachineFunction::iterator(ChainBB));
2912
2913 // Force alignment if all the predecessors are jumps. We already checked
2914 // that the block isn't cold above.
2915 if (!LayoutPred->isSuccessor(ChainBB)) {
2916 ChainBB->setAlignment(Align);
2917 continue;
2918 }
2919
2920 // Align this block if the layout predecessor's edge into this block is
2921 // cold relative to the block. When this is true, other predecessors make up
2922 // all of the hot entries into the block and thus alignment is likely to be
2923 // important.
2924 BranchProbability LayoutProb =
2925 MBPI->getEdgeProbability(LayoutPred, ChainBB);
2926 BlockFrequency LayoutEdgeFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(LayoutPred) * LayoutProb;
2927 if (LayoutEdgeFreq <= (Freq * ColdProb))
2928 ChainBB->setAlignment(Align);
2929 }
2930}
2931
2932/// Tail duplicate \p BB into (some) predecessors if profitable, repeating if
2933/// it was duplicated into its chain predecessor and removed.
2934/// \p BB - Basic block that may be duplicated.
2935///
2936/// \p LPred - Chosen layout predecessor of \p BB.
2937/// Updated to be the chain end if LPred is removed.
2938/// \p Chain - Chain to which \p LPred belongs, and \p BB will belong.
2939/// \p BlockFilter - Set of blocks that belong to the loop being laid out.
2940/// Used to identify which blocks to update predecessor
2941/// counts.
2942/// \p PrevUnplacedBlockIt - Iterator pointing to the last block that was
2943/// chosen in the given order due to unnatural CFG
2944/// only needed if \p BB is removed and
2945/// \p PrevUnplacedBlockIt pointed to \p BB.
2946/// @return true if \p BB was removed.
2947bool MachineBlockPlacement::repeatedlyTailDuplicateBlock(
2948 MachineBasicBlock *BB, MachineBasicBlock *&LPred,
2949 const MachineBasicBlock *LoopHeaderBB,
2950 BlockChain &Chain, BlockFilterSet *BlockFilter,
2951 MachineFunction::iterator &PrevUnplacedBlockIt) {
2952 bool Removed, DuplicatedToLPred;
2953 bool DuplicatedToOriginalLPred;
2954 Removed = maybeTailDuplicateBlock(BB, LPred, Chain, BlockFilter,
2955 PrevUnplacedBlockIt,
2956 DuplicatedToLPred);
2957 if (!Removed)
2958 return false;
2959 DuplicatedToOriginalLPred = DuplicatedToLPred;
2960 // Iteratively try to duplicate again. It can happen that a block that is
2961 // duplicated into is still small enough to be duplicated again.
2962 // No need to call markBlockSuccessors in this case, as the blocks being
2963 // duplicated from here on are already scheduled.
2964 while (DuplicatedToLPred && Removed) {
2965 MachineBasicBlock *DupBB, *DupPred;
2966 // The removal callback causes Chain.end() to be updated when a block is
2967 // removed. On the first pass through the loop, the chain end should be the
2968 // same as it was on function entry. On subsequent passes, because we are
2969 // duplicating the block at the end of the chain, if it is removed the
2970 // chain will have shrunk by one block.
2971 BlockChain::iterator ChainEnd = Chain.end();
2972 DupBB = *(--ChainEnd);
2973 // Now try to duplicate again.
2974 if (ChainEnd == Chain.begin())
2975 break;
2976 DupPred = *std::prev(ChainEnd);
2977 Removed = maybeTailDuplicateBlock(DupBB, DupPred, Chain, BlockFilter,
2978 PrevUnplacedBlockIt,
2979 DuplicatedToLPred);
2980 }
2981 // If BB was duplicated into LPred, it is now scheduled. But because it was
2982 // removed, markChainSuccessors won't be called for its chain. Instead we
2983 // call markBlockSuccessors for LPred to achieve the same effect. This must go
2984 // at the end because repeating the tail duplication can increase the number
2985 // of unscheduled predecessors.
2986 LPred = *std::prev(Chain.end());
2987 if (DuplicatedToOriginalLPred)
2988 markBlockSuccessors(Chain, LPred, LoopHeaderBB, BlockFilter);
2989 return true;
2990}
2991
2992/// Tail duplicate \p BB into (some) predecessors if profitable.
2993/// \p BB - Basic block that may be duplicated
2994/// \p LPred - Chosen layout predecessor of \p BB
2995/// \p Chain - Chain to which \p LPred belongs, and \p BB will belong.
2996/// \p BlockFilter - Set of blocks that belong to the loop being laid out.
2997/// Used to identify which blocks to update predecessor
2998/// counts.
2999/// \p PrevUnplacedBlockIt - Iterator pointing to the last block that was
3000/// chosen in the given order due to unnatural CFG
3001/// only needed if \p BB is removed and
3002/// \p PrevUnplacedBlockIt pointed to \p BB.
3003/// \p DuplicatedToLPred - True if the block was duplicated into LPred.
3004/// \return - True if the block was duplicated into all preds and removed.
3005bool MachineBlockPlacement::maybeTailDuplicateBlock(
3006 MachineBasicBlock *BB, MachineBasicBlock *LPred,
3007 BlockChain &Chain, BlockFilterSet *BlockFilter,
3008 MachineFunction::iterator &PrevUnplacedBlockIt,
3009 bool &DuplicatedToLPred) {
3010 DuplicatedToLPred = false;
3011 if (!shouldTailDuplicate(BB))
3012 return false;
3013
3014 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Redoing tail duplication for Succ#" << BB->getNumber()
3015 << "\n");
3016
3017 // This has to be a callback because none of it can be done after
3018 // BB is deleted.
3019 bool Removed = false;
3020 auto RemovalCallback =
3021 [&](MachineBasicBlock *RemBB) {
3022 // Signal to outer function
3023 Removed = true;
3024
3025 // Conservative default.
3026 bool InWorkList = true;
3027 // Remove from the Chain and Chain Map
3028 if (BlockToChain.count(RemBB)) {
3029 BlockChain *Chain = BlockToChain[RemBB];
3030 InWorkList = Chain->UnscheduledPredecessors == 0;
3031 Chain->remove(RemBB);
3032 BlockToChain.erase(RemBB);
3033 }
3034
3035 // Handle the unplaced block iterator
3036 if (&(*PrevUnplacedBlockIt) == RemBB) {
3037 PrevUnplacedBlockIt++;
3038 }
3039
3040 // Handle the Work Lists
3041 if (InWorkList) {
3042 SmallVectorImpl<MachineBasicBlock *> &RemoveList = BlockWorkList;
3043 if (RemBB->isEHPad())
3044 RemoveList = EHPadWorkList;
3045 llvm::erase_value(RemoveList, RemBB);
3046 }
3047
3048 // Handle the filter set
3049 if (BlockFilter) {
3050 BlockFilter->remove(RemBB);
3051 }
3052
3053 // Remove the block from loop info.
3054 MLI->removeBlock(RemBB);
3055 if (RemBB == PreferredLoopExit)
3056 PreferredLoopExit = nullptr;
3057
3058 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "TailDuplicator deleted block: "
3059 << getBlockName(RemBB) << "\n");
3060 };
3061 auto RemovalCallbackRef =
3062 function_ref<void(MachineBasicBlock*)>(RemovalCallback);
3063
3064 SmallVector<MachineBasicBlock *, 8> DuplicatedPreds;
3065 bool IsSimple = TailDup.isSimpleBB(BB);
3066 SmallVector<MachineBasicBlock *, 8> CandidatePreds;
3067 SmallVectorImpl<MachineBasicBlock *> *CandidatePtr = nullptr;
3068 if (F->getFunction().hasProfileData()) {
3069 // We can do partial duplication with precise profile information.
3070 findDuplicateCandidates(CandidatePreds, BB, BlockFilter);
3071 if (CandidatePreds.size() == 0)
3072 return false;
3073 if (CandidatePreds.size() < BB->pred_size())
3074 CandidatePtr = &CandidatePreds;
3075 }
3076 TailDup.tailDuplicateAndUpdate(IsSimple, BB, LPred, &DuplicatedPreds,
3077 &RemovalCallbackRef, CandidatePtr);
3078
3079 // Update UnscheduledPredecessors to reflect tail-duplication.
3080 DuplicatedToLPred = false;
3081 for (MachineBasicBlock *Pred : DuplicatedPreds) {
3082 // We're only looking for unscheduled predecessors that match the filter.
3083 BlockChain* PredChain = BlockToChain[Pred];
3084 if (Pred == LPred)
3085 DuplicatedToLPred = true;
3086 if (Pred == LPred || (BlockFilter && !BlockFilter->count(Pred))
3087 || PredChain == &Chain)
3088 continue;
3089 for (MachineBasicBlock *NewSucc : Pred->successors()) {
3090 if (BlockFilter && !BlockFilter->count(NewSucc))
3091 continue;
3092 BlockChain *NewChain = BlockToChain[NewSucc];
3093 if (NewChain != &Chain && NewChain != PredChain)
3094 NewChain->UnscheduledPredecessors++;
3095 }
3096 }
3097 return Removed;
3098}
3099
3100// Count the number of actual machine instructions.
3101static uint64_t countMBBInstruction(MachineBasicBlock *MBB) {
3102 uint64_t InstrCount = 0;
3103 for (MachineInstr &MI : *MBB) {
3104 if (!MI.isPHI() && !MI.isMetaInstruction())
3105 InstrCount += 1;
3106 }
3107 return InstrCount;
3108}
3109
3110// The size cost of duplication is the instruction size of the duplicated block.
3111// So we should scale the threshold accordingly. But the instruction size is not
3112// available on all targets, so we use the number of instructions instead.
3113BlockFrequency MachineBlockPlacement::scaleThreshold(MachineBasicBlock *BB) {
3114 return DupThreshold.getFrequency() * countMBBInstruction(BB);
3115}
3116
3117// Returns true if BB is Pred's best successor.
3118bool MachineBlockPlacement::isBestSuccessor(MachineBasicBlock *BB,
3119 MachineBasicBlock *Pred,
3120 BlockFilterSet *BlockFilter) {
3121 if (BB == Pred)
3122 return false;
3123 if (BlockFilter && !BlockFilter->count(Pred))
3124 return false;
3125 BlockChain *PredChain = BlockToChain[Pred];
3126 if (PredChain && (Pred != *std::prev(PredChain->end())))
3127 return false;
3128
3129 // Find the successor with largest probability excluding BB.
3130 BranchProbability BestProb = BranchProbability::getZero();
3131 for (MachineBasicBlock *Succ : Pred->successors())
3132 if (Succ != BB) {
3133 if (BlockFilter && !BlockFilter->count(Succ))
3134 continue;
3135 BlockChain *SuccChain = BlockToChain[Succ];
3136 if (SuccChain && (Succ != *SuccChain->begin()))
3137 continue;
3138 BranchProbability SuccProb = MBPI->getEdgeProbability(Pred, Succ);
3139 if (SuccProb > BestProb)
3140 BestProb = SuccProb;
3141 }
3142
3143 BranchProbability BBProb = MBPI->getEdgeProbability(Pred, BB);
3144 if (BBProb <= BestProb)
3145 return false;
3146
3147 // Compute the number of reduced taken branches if Pred falls through to BB
3148 // instead of another successor. Then compare it with threshold.
3149 BlockFrequency PredFreq = getBlockCountOrFrequency(Pred);
3150 BlockFrequency Gain = PredFreq * (BBProb - BestProb);
3151 return Gain > scaleThreshold(BB);
3152}
3153
3154// Find out the predecessors of BB and BB can be beneficially duplicated into
3155// them.
3156void MachineBlockPlacement::findDuplicateCandidates(
3157 SmallVectorImpl<MachineBasicBlock *> &Candidates,
3158 MachineBasicBlock *BB,
3159 BlockFilterSet *BlockFilter) {
3160 MachineBasicBlock *Fallthrough = nullptr;
3161 BranchProbability DefaultBranchProb = BranchProbability::getZero();
3162 BlockFrequency BBDupThreshold(scaleThreshold(BB));
3163 SmallVector<MachineBasicBlock *, 8> Preds(BB->predecessors());
3164 SmallVector<MachineBasicBlock *, 8> Succs(BB->successors());
3165
3166 // Sort for highest frequency.
3167 auto CmpSucc = [&](MachineBasicBlock *A, MachineBasicBlock *B) {
3168 return MBPI->getEdgeProbability(BB, A) > MBPI->getEdgeProbability(BB, B);
3169 };
3170 auto CmpPred = [&](MachineBasicBlock *A, MachineBasicBlock *B) {
3171 return MBFI->getBlockFreq(A) > MBFI->getBlockFreq(B);
3172 };
3173 llvm::stable_sort(Succs, CmpSucc);
3174 llvm::stable_sort(Preds, CmpPred);
3175
3176 auto SuccIt = Succs.begin();
3177 if (SuccIt != Succs.end()) {
3178 DefaultBranchProb = MBPI->getEdgeProbability(BB, *SuccIt).getCompl();
3179 }
3180
3181 // For each predecessors of BB, compute the benefit of duplicating BB,
3182 // if it is larger than the threshold, add it into Candidates.
3183 //
3184 // If we have following control flow.
3185 //
3186 // PB1 PB2 PB3 PB4
3187 // \ | / /\
3188 // \ | / / \
3189 // \ |/ / \
3190 // BB----/ OB
3191 // /\
3192 // / \
3193 // SB1 SB2
3194 //
3195 // And it can be partially duplicated as
3196 //
3197 // PB2+BB
3198 // | PB1 PB3 PB4
3199 // | | / /\
3200 // | | / / \
3201 // | |/ / \
3202 // | BB----/ OB
3203 // |\ /|
3204 // | X |
3205 // |/ \|
3206 // SB2 SB1
3207 //
3208 // The benefit of duplicating into a predecessor is defined as
3209 // Orig_taken_branch - Duplicated_taken_branch
3210 //
3211 // The Orig_taken_branch is computed with the assumption that predecessor
3212 // jumps to BB and the most possible successor is laid out after BB.
3213 //
3214 // The Duplicated_taken_branch is computed with the assumption that BB is
3215 // duplicated into PB, and one successor is layout after it (SB1 for PB1 and
3216 // SB2 for PB2 in our case). If there is no available successor, the combined
3217 // block jumps to all BB's successor, like PB3 in this example.
3218 //
3219 // If a predecessor has multiple successors, so BB can't be duplicated into
3220 // it. But it can beneficially fall through to BB, and duplicate BB into other
3221 // predecessors.
3222 for (MachineBasicBlock *Pred : Preds) {
3223 BlockFrequency PredFreq = getBlockCountOrFrequency(Pred);
3224
3225 if (!TailDup.canTailDuplicate(BB, Pred)) {
3226 // BB can't be duplicated into Pred, but it is possible to be layout
3227 // below Pred.
3228 if (!Fallthrough && isBestSuccessor(BB, Pred, BlockFilter)) {
3229 Fallthrough = Pred;
3230 if (SuccIt != Succs.end())
3231 SuccIt++;
3232 }
3233 continue;
3234 }
3235
3236 BlockFrequency OrigCost = PredFreq + PredFreq * DefaultBranchProb;
3237 BlockFrequency DupCost;
3238 if (SuccIt == Succs.end()) {
3239 // Jump to all successors;
3240 if (Succs.size() > 0)
3241 DupCost += PredFreq;
3242 } else {
3243 // Fallthrough to *SuccIt, jump to all other successors;
3244 DupCost += PredFreq;
3245 DupCost -= PredFreq * MBPI->getEdgeProbability(BB, *SuccIt);
3246 }
3247
3248 assert(OrigCost >= DupCost);
3249 OrigCost -= DupCost;
3250 if (OrigCost > BBDupThreshold) {
3251 Candidates.push_back(Pred);
3252 if (SuccIt != Succs.end())
3253 SuccIt++;
3254 }
3255 }
3256
3257 // No predecessors can optimally fallthrough to BB.
3258 // So we can change one duplication into fallthrough.
3259 if (!Fallthrough) {
3260 if ((Candidates.size() < Preds.size()) && (Candidates.size() > 0)) {
3261 Candidates[0] = Candidates.back();
3262 Candidates.pop_back();
3263 }
3264 }
3265}
3266
3267void MachineBlockPlacement::initDupThreshold() {
3268 DupThreshold = 0;
3269 if (!F->getFunction().hasProfileData())
3270 return;
3271
3272 // We prefer to use prifile count.
3273 uint64_t HotThreshold = PSI->getOrCompHotCountThreshold();
3274 if (HotThreshold != UINT64_MAX) {
3275 UseProfileCount = true;
3276 DupThreshold = HotThreshold * TailDupProfilePercentThreshold / 100;
3277 return;
3278 }
3279
3280 // Profile count is not available, we can use block frequency instead.
3281 BlockFrequency MaxFreq = 0;
3282 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *F) {
3283 BlockFrequency Freq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(&MBB);
3284 if (Freq > MaxFreq)
3285 MaxFreq = Freq;
3286 }
3287
3288 BranchProbability ThresholdProb(TailDupPlacementPenalty, 100);
3289 DupThreshold = MaxFreq * ThresholdProb;
3290 UseProfileCount = false;
3291}
3292
3293bool MachineBlockPlacement::runOnMachineFunction(MachineFunction &MF) {
3294 if (skipFunction(MF.getFunction()))
3295 return false;
3296
3297 // Check for single-block functions and skip them.
3298 if (std::next(MF.begin()) == MF.end())
3299 return false;
3300
3301 F = &MF;
3302 MBPI = &getAnalysis<MachineBranchProbabilityInfo>();
3303 MBFI = std::make_unique<MBFIWrapper>(
3304 getAnalysis<MachineBlockFrequencyInfo>());
3305 MLI = &getAnalysis<MachineLoopInfo>();
3306 TII = MF.getSubtarget().getInstrInfo();
3307 TLI = MF.getSubtarget().getTargetLowering();
3308 MPDT = nullptr;
3309 PSI = &getAnalysis<ProfileSummaryInfoWrapperPass>().getPSI();
3310
3311 initDupThreshold();
3312
3313 // Initialize PreferredLoopExit to nullptr here since it may never be set if
3314 // there are no MachineLoops.
3315 PreferredLoopExit = nullptr;
3316
3317 assert(BlockToChain.empty() &&
3318 "BlockToChain map should be empty before starting placement.");
3319 assert(ComputedEdges.empty() &&
3320 "Computed Edge map should be empty before starting placement.");
3321
3322 unsigned TailDupSize = TailDupPlacementThreshold;
3323 // If only the aggressive threshold is explicitly set, use it.
3324 if (TailDupPlacementAggressiveThreshold.getNumOccurrences() != 0 &&
3325 TailDupPlacementThreshold.getNumOccurrences() == 0)
3326 TailDupSize = TailDupPlacementAggressiveThreshold;
3327
3328 TargetPassConfig *PassConfig = &getAnalysis<TargetPassConfig>();
3329 // For aggressive optimization, we can adjust some thresholds to be less
3330 // conservative.
3331 if (PassConfig->getOptLevel() >= CodeGenOpt::Aggressive) {
3332 // At O3 we should be more willing to copy blocks for tail duplication. This
3333 // increases size pressure, so we only do it at O3
3334 // Do this unless only the regular threshold is explicitly set.
3335 if (TailDupPlacementThreshold.getNumOccurrences() == 0 ||
3336 TailDupPlacementAggressiveThreshold.getNumOccurrences() != 0)
3337 TailDupSize = TailDupPlacementAggressiveThreshold;
3338 }
3339
3340 if (allowTailDupPlacement()) {
3341 MPDT = &getAnalysis<MachinePostDominatorTree>();
3342 bool OptForSize = MF.getFunction().hasOptSize() ||
3343 llvm::shouldOptimizeForSize(&MF, PSI, &MBFI->getMBFI());
3344 if (OptForSize)
3345 TailDupSize = 1;
3346 bool PreRegAlloc = false;
3347 TailDup.initMF(MF, PreRegAlloc, MBPI, MBFI.get(), PSI,
3348 /* LayoutMode */ true, TailDupSize);
3349 precomputeTriangleChains();
3350 }
3351
3352 buildCFGChains();
3353
3354 // Changing the layout can create new tail merging opportunities.
3355 // TailMerge can create jump into if branches that make CFG irreducible for
3356 // HW that requires structured CFG.
3357 bool EnableTailMerge = !MF.getTarget().requiresStructuredCFG() &&
3358 PassConfig->getEnableTailMerge() &&
3359 BranchFoldPlacement;
3360 // No tail merging opportunities if the block number is less than four.
3361 if (MF.size() > 3 && EnableTailMerge) {
3362 unsigned TailMergeSize = TailDupSize + 1;
3363 BranchFolder BF(/*DefaultEnableTailMerge=*/true, /*CommonHoist=*/false,
3364 *MBFI, *MBPI, PSI, TailMergeSize);
3365
3366 if (BF.OptimizeFunction(MF, TII, MF.getSubtarget().getRegisterInfo(), MLI,
3367 /*AfterPlacement=*/true)) {
3368 // Redo the layout if tail merging creates/removes/moves blocks.
3369 BlockToChain.clear();
3370 ComputedEdges.clear();
3371 // Must redo the post-dominator tree if blocks were changed.
3372 if (MPDT)
3373 MPDT->runOnMachineFunction(MF);
3374 ChainAllocator.DestroyAll();
3375 buildCFGChains();
3376 }
3377 }
3378
3379 optimizeBranches();
3380 alignBlocks();
3381
3382 BlockToChain.clear();
3383 ComputedEdges.clear();
3384 ChainAllocator.DestroyAll();
3385
3386 if (AlignAllBlock)
3387 // Align all of the blocks in the function to a specific alignment.
3388 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : MF)
3389 MBB.setAlignment(Align(1ULL << AlignAllBlock));
3390 else if (AlignAllNonFallThruBlocks) {
3391 // Align all of the blocks that have no fall-through predecessors to a
3392 // specific alignment.
3393 for (auto MBI = std::next(MF.begin()), MBE = MF.end(); MBI != MBE; ++MBI) {
3394 auto LayoutPred = std::prev(MBI);
3395 if (!LayoutPred->isSuccessor(&*MBI))
3396 MBI->setAlignment(Align(1ULL << AlignAllNonFallThruBlocks));
3397 }
3398 }
3399 if (ViewBlockLayoutWithBFI != GVDT_None &&
3400 (ViewBlockFreqFuncName.empty() ||
3401 F->getFunction().getName().equals(ViewBlockFreqFuncName))) {
3402 MBFI->view("MBP." + MF.getName(), false);
3403 }
3404
3405
3406 // We always return true as we have no way to track whether the final order
3407 // differs from the original order.
3408 return true;
3409}

3411namespace {
3412
3413/// A pass to compute block placement statistics.
3414///
3415/// A separate pass to compute interesting statistics for evaluating block
3416/// placement. This is separate from the actual placement pass so that they can
3417/// be computed in the absence of any placement transformations or when using
3418/// alternative placement strategies.
3419class MachineBlockPlacementStats : public MachineFunctionPass {
3420 /// A handle to the branch probability pass.
3421 const MachineBranchProbabilityInfo *MBPI;
3422
3423 /// A handle to the function-wide block frequency pass.
3424 const MachineBlockFrequencyInfo *MBFI;
3425
3426public:
3427 static char ID; // Pass identification, replacement for typeid
3428
3429 MachineBlockPlacementStats() : MachineFunctionPass(ID) {
3430 initializeMachineBlockPlacementStatsPass(*PassRegistry::getPassRegistry());
3431 }
3432
3433 bool runOnMachineFunction(MachineFunction &F) override;
3434
3435 void getAnalysisUsage(AnalysisUsage &AU) const override {
3436 AU.addRequired<MachineBranchProbabilityInfo>();
3437 AU.addRequired<MachineBlockFrequencyInfo>();
3438 AU.setPreservesAll();
3439 MachineFunctionPass::getAnalysisUsage(AU);
3440 }
3441};
3442
3443} // end anonymous namespace
3444
3445char MachineBlockPlacementStats::ID = 0;
3446
3447char &llvm::MachineBlockPlacementStatsID = MachineBlockPlacementStats::ID;
3448
3449INITIALIZE_PASS_BEGIN(MachineBlockPlacementStats, "block-placement-stats",
3450 "Basic Block Placement Stats", false, false)
3451INITIALIZE_PASS_DEPENDENCY(MachineBranchProbabilityInfo)
3452INITIALIZE_PASS_DEPENDENCY(MachineBlockFrequencyInfo)
3453INITIALIZE_PASS_END(MachineBlockPlacementStats, "block-placement-stats",
3454 "Basic Block Placement Stats", false, false)
3455
3456bool MachineBlockPlacementStats::runOnMachineFunction(MachineFunction &F) {
3457 // Check for single-block functions and skip them.
3458 if (std::next(F.begin()) == F.end())
3459 return false;
3460
3461 MBPI = &getAnalysis<MachineBranchProbabilityInfo>();
3462 MBFI = &getAnalysis<MachineBlockFrequencyInfo>();
3463
3464 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : F) {
3465 BlockFrequency BlockFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(&MBB);
3466 Statistic &NumBranches =
3467 (MBB.succ_size() > 1) ? NumCondBranches : NumUncondBranches;
3468 Statistic &BranchTakenFreq =
3469 (MBB.succ_size() > 1) ? CondBranchTakenFreq : UncondBranchTakenFreq;
3470 for (MachineBasicBlock *Succ : MBB.successors()) {
3471 // Skip if this successor is a fallthrough.
3472 if (MBB.isLayoutSuccessor(Succ))
3473 continue;
3474
3475 BlockFrequency EdgeFreq =
3476 BlockFreq * MBPI->getEdgeProbability(&MBB, Succ);
3477 ++NumBranches;
3478 BranchTakenFreq += EdgeFreq.getFrequency();
3479 }
3480 }
3481
3482 return false;
3483}
